text:
Hi all !
As a proud newbie on React, currently building my first React UI extension!
Wondering how to deal with multiple JS functions in app.functions.
Indeed, let’s say I have a first JS function to fetch associated objects to my record, and another JS function to query external data thanks to hs_object_id.
• Do I need to have one JS file per function ?
• Or could I have one single JS file, with multiple module exports that I can query individually in my JSX file ?
Thanks!
I'm sorry Raman...busy few days with kids.  I'm traveling today and will be available next week starting on Tuesday.
Send me a DM and we can put something on the calendar
Ok sure let me know when you will be available then we can connect

as far as I know is, that you need one js file per function if you want to have a callback / return to show in the frontend.

in the Serverless function itself you can have more function than one. But all these functions have to be in this file. => hope thats right and hope that helps :)
You do need to have one .js file per function. At this point, they are not re-usable modules.
